alert.note: Alert for Hatteras Island (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 3:02PM EST until February 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST FRIDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM TO 2 PM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 6 to 9 feet expected in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, 1 to 2 feet of inundation above ground level expected in low-lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways adjacent to the Pamlico Sound. * WHERE...Hatteras Island. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, from 3 AM to 2 PM EST Friday. For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions.
